result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott E Tolbert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Consecutive to: 14CM2316

miscConds.notes: Submit to a psychological assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

No contact with C.G. or her son.  Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Follow through with any treatment/counseling.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Court costs waived.
DNA Surcharge waived.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott E Tolbert

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant is Deceased
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Scott E Tolbert in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1. Court conducts colloquy.  Court finds defendant guilty. Count 2 and Count 3 are dismissed and read in.  Case 15FO23 is dismissed and read in. 
Court orders the following:
-  4 months 15 days Huber with standard release conditions. STAYED Consecutive to 2014CM2316. 
- 18 months Probation. 
- Court costs WAIVED
- DNA Surcharge WAIVED
- Conditions of Probation: Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Submit to a psychological assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.  No contact with C.G. or her son.
Jail Inmate Communications form requesting that the Court review the defendant's medical records while incarated. Request is denied by the Court.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
from Sheriff's Department regarding defendant's conduct

Defendant Scott E Tolbert in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Neither party challenges the doctor's report.  Court accepts the doctor's report and finds the defendant competent to proceed in this matter.  Defense requests plea and sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
2 Jail Inmate Communications Forms in regards to the conditions of the jail.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Scott E Tolbert in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT. Defendant allowed a phone call. 
  Hearing scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 10:30 am.
